Oh, you all know what it is! :D (this is apparently a legit thing that is legit ahem ANYWAY) So here we are, eight years after the fact, taking a look back at the one and only Refugee! I guess I'll start off the title. Refugee was named, like so many other fanfics of mine, in desperation because I couldn't think of a better title. Actually, I had the most perfect title in the world for it: "Damned If I Do", from the Alan Parsons Project song of the same name. Here, take a listen: The song fits their relationship in my fic absolutely perfectly, and in another dimension the fic probably would have been called "Damned If I Do". But ff.net had (and I assume still has) a rule in place that the summaries and titles need to stay G-rated. I didn't want to risk getting my fic deleted and myself possibly banned from the site because of the (absolutely perfect) title, so I had to make do with just making it the title of chapter five instead. (Loophole abuse; I don't recall any rules regarding the titles of the chapters.) ;) Anyway, I had a decent-sized playlist on my iTunes of Mojo/Blossom songs to listen to while writing, and basically for lack of any better ideas, I pulled the name from a Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers song. (would you look at all of those glorious seventies hairstyles in this video?! what a goldmine unf) The song, and title, fits... sort of. It's not a great match. But I will admit that every time I hear this song on the radio (which is fairly often; the classic rock station I listen to seems to quite like Tom Petty), I always think back to Mojo/Blossom. :) Now, as for the story itself. This is... kind of hard to write from a "here's what I was thinking" standpoint, because, in some ways, I feel very detached from this fic. Not in the fact that I don't care about it, but more in the fact that I have no idea where half of the ideas came from. I think it's fair to say that the pairing's one of the tamest things about this story. The pairing's really only a side note in a lot of ways. A lot of the fic is about: Blossom's perfect memory superpower, and why it's a classic case of being Cursed with Awesome! What really happened when the Powerpuff Girls (and Mojo Jojo) were created! What the results should have been, and why they didn't actually turn out that way! What happens when Mojo becomes truly unhinged! What happens when Blossom reaches the end of her rope! What happens when Blossom's death is imminent and Mojo decides "none of that shit, I want to be directly responsible for her death!" And so on and so on. Reading it now, I feel kind of bombarded by idea after dark idea after dark character study, over and over again. This fic really layers it on. Did I succeed in making all of those ideas cohesive and relevant? Eh... sort of. I wouldn't say this fic's a total failure or anything--in fact, I'm actually still able to read it without cringing (for the most part), which is more than can be said for pretty much every other fic I wrote around that time and even after (hell, some I haven't even been able to open and reread for years now because the simple thought of them embarrasses me to no end). If I hadn't written Refugee, would I be able to write it now? I don't honestly know. Whatever state of mind I was in back then, I'm not sure I could get back there now. There are some things I'd definitely change, though. 1. The Girls' ages. I don't know if it was because I was only twenty myself when I wrote it, but for whatever reason I thought fifteen was plenty old enough. If I were to rewrite this story now I'd make them at the very least seventeen, probably eighteen (or older, if I decided to ditch the high school setting). 2. The one part where the school kids were making gossipy, crude assumptions of the PPGs' sex lives, and Buttercup got offended when one assumed that she and Blossom had a thing. I meant for that to show that Buttercup didn't care what others thought of her but did get defensive on her sisters' behalf, and also that "just because we're close doesn't mean we're fucking; we're sisters" although I have read some very good fanfics that are PPG incest, so even though it's not my cup of tea I can't protest too much It wasn't well handled in the story, though, and I can see why some readers thought it came across as homophobic. I'd probably just cut that part out entirely, since I could have gotten the idea of Buttercup being fiercely defensive when it came to her sisters shown in a much better way. 3. The whole "Blossom can't hear Mojo's thoughts! Oh, now she suddenly can! Oh, now Mojo has the ability to hide some things from her because I said so! Oh, now Blossom can totally separate their minds because... BECAUSE!" thing. If I was going to write a story about two characters basically sharing each others' minds, I needed to fully commit to it, and not go "oh, but I need their thoughts to remain separate and private now! RESET!" It was just plain lazy writing on my part. :/ However, I still feel relatively proud of this story despite all that, even if it's just in a mile-marker, turning-point kind of way. Despite some of the things I didn't fully commit to, I definitely did fully commit to the fact that I was writing a hero/villain story, especially remembering the villain part of that. Blossom's right in the fic; Mojo is pretty much psychotic in this. He's evil, entitled, possessive, sadistic, volatile, and self-serving; and I think one of this story's greatest strengths was that I was able to clearly show all of that, without any white-washing, while at the same time showing that Mojo really did, in his own twisted way, love Blossom. Interestingly, though, this may be one of the major reasons why I couldn't write a story like this anymore, or at the very least have great difficulty in writing it. There's no beating around the bush here: Mojo and Blossom have a very abusive relationship in this story, mentally and emotionally if not physically (although there is some of that, too). And I am happy to say that even when I wrote this I was describing their relationship as completely messed up and definitely NOT something one should strive for. I mean, I killed them both off at the end; how more clearly could I state that their relationship was not ideal? I've become a lot more sensitive to abuse in stories, especially romanticized abuse, and while I don't think I quite crossed that line, I did play with it a lot. Again, I think I handled it pretty well, all things considered... and after all, when writing a hero/villain pairing, there's going to be a lot of dancing close to that line anyway. But I was definitely pushing the limits of how dark I could take this story. For the record, if anyone's wondering this: yes, I still ship Mojo/Blossom. They're still one of my biggest OTPS. :D But, having said that, I'll admit that there's not a whole lot of ways to write a longer story of them actually embarking on a relationship. Given their personalities, even if there's a lot of unresolved attraction on either of their parts, I think one of the only ways these two would actually get together would be if Blossom had some problem that Mojo and only Mojo could help her with, or vice-versa. This is actually why I think Mojo/Bubbles is a lot easier to write in some ways (and why I find Bubbles so easy to ship with pretty much any other character); Bubbles is definitely more the type to readily admit an attraction and budding feelings and to pursue them. Blossom would definitely make denial more than just a river in Egypt. Mojo as well, although I think between the two of them, Blossom's the more emotionally stubborn. Just my thoughts, of course. :) I'm not on Deviantart anymore, but I'm pleasantly surprised to see that there's a bit of Mojo/Blossom still around, and names I don't recognize saying that they ship it. (Of course, they're still totally outnumbered by PPG/RRB shippers, but what are ya gonna do?) There's a small amount of Mojo/Blossom fics on ff.net now, too, again some written by names I don't recognize from my more involved days in the fandom years ago. So it makes me happy. :) I'm not sure I'd actually want to see Mojo/Blossom become overly popular; I like the thrill of finding those hidden gems. And finally, I feel like I can't discuss Refugee without discussing its importance in my fanfic writing "career" as a whole. This fic was in many ways wholly different from anything I'd ever written before. I've already mentioned how it (well, and its prequel, Hero Worship) were me really for the first time plunging into some really dark ideas and character studies, but Refugee stands out for other reasons, too. It was my first M-rated story. It was my first story that I actually sat down and wrote out completely before even starting to post it online, rather than posting chapters as I completed them. As a result, it became my first truly cohesive piece, since I was able to go through and edit earlier chapters to make them better flow into later ones if need be. It was my first flame, and then some. :P Will I write more Mojo/Blossom? I don't know. I'd need to be struck with another idea first. If (and hopefully when) I write more PPG fanfic, it would probably be a sequel to Refugee, and obviously that wouldn't be Mojo/Blossom, since they're both dead as doornails. :P I do have a plot in mind, at least a beginning and an end, and I don't want to give away too much in case I do ever actually write/finish it, but I will say that Buttercup's mostly the main character, although Bubbles does come back and become very important to the story as well, and that Him is the main villain. And with Him being the villain, the threat is much more psychological than anything else. I'm not super good at writing those kinds of things, though (seriously, I'm envious of all of the writers who can write Him well; it's a talent I certainly lack), which is why the entire rising action part of the story is still very murky in my mind. I did actually start the story once, and have it stored in my email somewhere, although I barely got a thousand words in, and it was mostly just set-up. I do hope that someday, somehow, I can figure out that middle act and get it written and completed. :) Hopefully next time I update my LJ, it'll be with the finished one-shot (hopefully) that I'm working on right now. It's a pairing I've never written for before, but I have mentioned liking it in the past, and even drew some fanart for way back when. It's also not hero/villain (well... they're both kind of morally ambiguous characters, but they're generally considered protagonists, so whatever), AND they're both actually the same species! I know, what a concept for me, lol :P

OKAY OKAY BACK THIS SHIT UP. He wasn't certain that he would have gotten to the point of asking Lisa for a divorce. She'd been the one to leave him. Okay... a couple of things. First off, if it got to the point that it was "obvious" there was no love or affection left, then yes, a divorce WOULD have been the right thing to do! And secondly, how far was your head up your ass to not realize how unhappy your wife was right up to the time she divorced you? Way to make your male lead sound attentive and caring! I can understand that the average guy would feel uncomfortable with his best friend sleeping with his much younger (though still legal) sister. HOLY CRAP YOU TWO SHE'S TWENTY-FOUR YEARS OLD! LET HER MAKE HER DATING DECISIONS ON HER OWN! Blargh. Here's another choice quote:

I'm not saying you won't have time for your other interests. Just that my interests will come first." His arrogance should so get her back up. Well, that makes one of us. :/ I know, I know, different strokes for different folks and all that, but why on earth would a guy saying "I'm coming first" (lol, that isn't usually considered a plus in a sexual relationship if the guy comes first... okay, I'll shut up now) be attractive to anyone? RUN AWAY, MIA! RUN FOR THE HILLS! THIS IS CREEPY AS FUCK! I'll give you a hint, Mia--it's not the second one. Gabe demands an answer from her, if all of her fears have been addressed, and Mia admits to herself that he had compromised where she hadn't believed he would. IF YOU DIDN'T THINK HE WAS GOING TO COMPROMISE, WHY DID YOU SAY FIRST THING THAT YOU ACCEPTED HIS PROPOSAL? WHY DID YOU QUIT YOUR JOB BEFORE YOU LEARNED ALL THIS?! I need a drink. :/ She tells him her answer is yes, and hands him the contract she already signed. ...um. Yeah. She signed it BEFORE they worked out their compromises. You figure out everything that's wrong with it, I'm too tired right now. :/ Although to be fair, she had already marked up and reworded the clauses she had issues with.
